alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 08 at 3:30AM PST until November 09 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * CHANGES...Extended the warning through late Wednesday morning due to continued travel impacts. * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches near Highway 395, except 1 to 3 feet west of Highway 395 above 7500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Wednesday. Heaviest snowfall rates expected from late this morning through early evening. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions will impact all peak commute times through Wednesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for whiteout conditions and sub-zero wind chills along ridgelines and near the mountain passes.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
